cards.name: "Ach! Hans, Run!"
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may say "Ach Hans, run It's the . . ." and name a creature card. If you do, search your library for the named card, put it into play, then shuffle your library. That creature has haste. Remove it from the game at end of turn.
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may say "Ach Hans, run It's the . . ." and the name of a creature card. If you do, search your library for a card with that name, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. That creature gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: AWOL
cards.originalText: Remove target attacking creature from the game. Then remove it from the removed-from-game zone and put it into the absolutely-removed-from-the-freaking-game-forever zone.

cards.name: Aesthetic Consultation
cards.originalText: Name an artist. Remove the top six cards of your library from the game, then reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a card by the named artist. Put that card in your hand, then remove all the other cards revealed this way from the game.
cards.text: Choose an artist. Exile the top six cards of your library, then reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a card with art by the chosen artist. Put that card in your hand and exile all other cards revealed this way.

cards.name: Ambiguity

cards.name: Head to Head
cards.originalText: You and target opponent play Seven Questions about the top card of that player's library. (That player looks at the card, then you ask up to six yes-or-no questions about the card that he or she answers truthfully. You guess the card's name—that's question seven—and the player reveals the card.) If you win, prevent all damage that would be dealt this turn by a source of your choice.
cards.text: You and target opponent play Seven Questions with the top card of that player's library. If you win, prevent all damage that would be dealt this turn by a source of your choice. (To play Seven Questions, that player looks at the card, then you ask up to six yes-or-no questions about the card that they answer truthfully. You guess the card's name—that's question seven—then the player reveals the card.)

cards.text:

All premium creatures get +1/+1.
cards.text:
Premium spells cost {1} less to cast.
Premium creatures get +1/+1.

cards.flavorText: You want "mise" with that?
cards.name: Supersize
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3½/+3½ until end of turn.
cards.text: Target creature gets +3½/+3½ until end of turn.

cards.flavorText: "Everyone break into teams. Weaponry, you're with me. Nature group, meet by the palm tree. Stoneworks and metalworks, follow the anvil. Everyone else, gather around the giant V." —Sword of Kaldra
cards.name: Symbol Status
cards.originalText: Put a 1/1 colorless Expansion-Symbol creature token into play for each different expansion symbol among permanents you control.
cards.text: Create a 1/1 colorless Expansion-Symbol creature token for each different expansion symbol among permanents you control.

cards.flavorText: "C'mon, choose 'monkey.' Everybody loves monkeys"
cards.name: Tainted Monkey
cards.originalText: {T}: Choose a word. Target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If that card has the chosen word in its text box, that player loses 3 life.
cards.text: {T}: Choose a word. Target player puts the top card of their library into their graveyard. If that card has the chosen word in its text box, that player loses 3 life.

cards.name: The Fallen Apart
cards.originalText:
The Fallen Apart comes into play with two arms and two legs.
Whenever damage is dealt to The Fallen Apart, remove an arm or a leg from it.
The Fallen Apart can't attack if it has no legs and can't block if it has no arms.
cards.text:
The Fallen Apart enters the battlefield with two arms and two legs.
Whenever damage is dealt to The Fallen Apart, remove an arm or a leg from it.
The Fallen Apart can't attack if it has no legs and can't block if it has no arms.

cards.name: Time Machine
cards.originalText: {T}: Remove Time Machine and target nontoken creature you own from the game. Return both cards to play at the beginning of your upkeep on your turn X of the next game you play with the same opponent, where X is the removed creature's converted mana cost.
cards.text: {T}: Exile Time Machine and target nontoken creature you own. Return them to the battlefield at the beginning of your upkeep on your turn X in the next game you play with one of your opponents in this game, where X is the converted mana cost of the exiled creature.

cards.name: Time Machine
cards.text: {T}: Exile Time Machine and target nontoken creature you own. Return them to the battlefield at the beginning of your upkeep on your turn X in the next game you play with one of your opponents in this game, where X is the converted mana cost of the exiled creature.

cards.name: Togglodyte
cards.originalText:
Togglodyte comes into play turned on.
Whenever a player plays a spell, toggle Togglodyte's ON/OFF switch.
As long as Togglodyte is turned off, it can't attack or block, and all damage it would deal is prevented.
cards.text:
Togglodyte enters the battlefield turned on.
Whenever a player casts a spell, toggle Togglodyte's ON/OFF switch.
As long as Togglodyte is turned off, it can't attack or block, and prevent all damage it would deal.

cards.flavorText: "Here on going is heck the what?"
cards.name: Topsy Turvy
cards.originalText:
The phases of each player's turn are reversed. (The phases are, in reverse order, end, postcombat main, combat, precombat main, and beginning.)
If there are more than two players in the game, the turn order is reversed.

rulings.text: Topsy Turvy was printed upside down relative to the Magic card back on the other side. Topsy Turvy is “upright” when the artwork is oriented at the bottom. That’s the joke! For more information, see http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/making-magic/get-it-unhinged-edition-part-1-2017-08-14

cards.text:
The phases of each player's turn are reversed. (The phases are, in reverse order, ending, postcombat main, combat, precombat main, and beginning.)
As long as there are more than two players in the game, the turn order is reversed.

cards.flavorText: Judge's ruling: The interior of the face still counts as the face, so a nose-pick is legitimate grounds for saying "Gotcha"
cards.name: Touch and Go
cards.originalText:
Destroy target land.
Gotcha Whenever an opponent touches his or her face, you may say "Gotcha" If you do, return Touch and Go from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.text:
Destroy target land.
Gotcha — If an opponent touches their face, you may say "Gotcha!" When you do, return Touch and Go from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Toy Boat
cards.originalText: Cumulative upkeep—Say "Toy Boat" quickly. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on Toy Boat, then sacrifice it unless you say "Toy Boat" once for each age counter on it—without pausing between or fumbling it.)
cards.text: Cumulative upkeep—Say "Toy Boat" quickly. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on Toy Boat, then sacrifice it unless you say "Toy Boat" once for each age counter on it—without pausing between or fumbling it.)

cards.flavorText: "I desire the acquisition of a potassium-rich fruit comestible of substantial magnitude."
cards.name: Uktabi Kong
cards.originalText:
Trample
When Uktabi Kong comes into play, destroy all artifacts.
Tap two untapped Apes you control: Put a 1/1 green Ape creature token into play.
cards.text:
Trample
When Uktabi Kong enters the battlefield, destroy all artifacts.
Tap two untapped Apes you control: Create a 1/1 green Ape creature token.

cards.flavorText: www.wizards.com/hottub
cards.name: Urza's Hot Tub
cards.originalText: {2}, Discard a card: Search your library for a card that shares a complete word in its name with the discarded card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.text: {2}, Discard a card: Search your library for a card that shares a complete word in its name with the discarded card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Vile Bile
cards.originalText: Whenever a player's skin or fingernail touches Vile Bile, that player loses 2 life.
cards.text: Whenever a player's skin or fingernail touches Vile Bile, that player loses 2 life.

cards.name: Water Gun Balloon Game
cards.originalText:
As Water Gun Balloon Game comes into play, each player puts a pop counter on a 0.
Whenever a player plays a spell, move that player's pop counter up 1.
Whenever a player's pop counter hits 5, that player puts a 5/5 pink Giant Teddy Bear creature token into play and resets all pop counters to 0.
cards.text:
As Water Gun Balloon Game enters the battlefield, each player puts a pop counter on a 0.
Whenever a player casts a spell, move that player's pop counter up 1.
Whenever a player's pop counter hits 5, that player creates a 5/5 pink Giant Teddy Bear creature token and resets all pop counters to 0.

cards.flavorText: Ever the warrior, Glissa responded with a "wedgie from beyond Uranus."
cards.name: Wet Willie of the Damned
cards.originalText: Wet Willie of the Damned deals 2½ damage to target creature or player and you gain 2½ life.
cards.text: Wet Willie of the Damned deals 2½ damage to any target and you gain 2½ life.

cards.flavorText: "Get it? Bunnies, letters, -X/-X? Me neither." —Bucky, flavor text writer
cards.name: When Fluffy Bunnies Attack
cards.originalText: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of times the letter of your choice appears in that creature's name.

cards.flavorText: Oh, does your nose itch?
cards.name: Working Stiff
cards.originalText:
As Working Stiff comes into play, straighten your arms.
When you bend an elbow, sacrifice Working Stiff.
cards.text:
As Working Stiff enters the battlefield, straighten your arms.
When you bend an elbow, sacrifice Working Stiff.

cards.flavorText: YOUR AD HERE
cards.name: World-Bottling Kit
cards.originalText: {5}, Sacrifice World-Bottling Kit: Choose a Magic set. Remove from the game all permanents with that set's expansion symbol except for basic lands.
cards.text: {5}, Sacrifice World-Bottling Kit: Choose a Magic set. Exile all permanents with that set's expansion symbol except for basic lands.

cards.flavorText: It puts the "vortex" in "flavortext."
cards.name: Yet Another Aether Vortex
cards.originalText:
All creatures have haste.
Players play with the top card of their libraries revealed.
Noninstant, nonsorcery cards on top of a library are in play under their owner's control in addition to being in that library.
cards.text:
All creatures have haste.
Players play with the top card of their libraries revealed.
Noninstant, nonsorcery cards on top of a library are on the battlefield under their owner's control in addition to being in that library.

cards.flavorText: The real advantage of being a zombie gamer? No one notices the stench.
cards.name: Zombie Fanboy
cards.originalText:
As Zombie Fanboy comes into play, choose an artist.
Whenever a permanent by the chosen artist is put into a graveyard, put two +1/+1 counters on Zombie Fanboy.
cards.text:
As Zombie Fanboy enters the battlefield, choose an artist.
Whenever a permanent with art by the chosen artist is put into a graveyard, put two +1/+1 counters on Zombie Fanboy.

cards.flavorText: Tired of always being picked last, the wizard Zzzyxas created the ultimate revenge.
cards.name: Zzzyxas's Abyss
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy all nonland permanents with the first name alphabetically among nonland permanents in play.
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy all nonland permanents with the first name alphabetically among nonland permanents.

cards.flavorText: {1}: This card's flavor text becomes the flavor text of your choice. (This ability doesn't work because it's flavor text, not rules text (but neither does this reminder text, so you figure it out).)
cards.originalText: {1}: This card's name becomes the name of your choice. Play this ability anywhere, anytime.
cards.text: {1}: This card's name becomes the card name of your choice. Activate this ability anywhere, anytime.
